INTERSHOP IOM 5.2.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision 6edb3d8be162fde081a9e6e668ef11ddc3664951)

Table oms.Shop2Supplier2ApprovalTypeDefDO

Order approval rules and further properties that are used by a shop. Optionally a supplier and payment provider (PSP) can be assigned.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id bigint PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL  
active boolean NOT_NULL Whether the rule assignment is active. 
isAffectingDOSEonChange boolean NOT_NULL false Whether an approval with changes can have an impact on the DOSE-process, and should therefore be re-used. 
approvalRank integer NOT_NULL 1 Priority of an approval rule which determines the execution before other rules. 
ApprovalTypeDefDO approvalTypeDefRef integer NOT_NULL The approval type of the rule. 
isOrderTransmission boolean NOT_NULL false Whether the approval should be considered as approval transmission to the supplier additionally. 
supplierApprovalTypeName varchar(50) The name of the approval type as used by the supplier instead of defaults. Example "General Approval" 
ShopDO shopRef bigint NOT_NULL The shop the approval type should be used for. 
SupplierDO supplierRef bigint Optional The supplier the approval rule should be used for. 
PaymentProviderDO paymentProviderRef bigint Optional The payment provider the rule should be used for. 
DecisionBeanDefDO decisionBeanDefRef integer Optional The custom implementation to check whether the approval rule is required for an order. If not set the approval is required. 
sendOrderApproval boolean NOT_NULL true Specifies whether to create a approval request for this configuration. This can be send to the supplier. 
supplierApprovalTypeDescription varchar(1000) Description of the approval type used at the supplier instead of defaults. In general this information is part of the approval request. Example "General Approval" 
manualApproval boolean NOT_NULL false Whether the approval can be done manually. 

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.
